I agree, people who leave should face harsher punishment LP wise.

A lot of people I've noticed look at where they're at, and choose to be bratty and DC because they can afford to lose 18-20LP. It makes it harder to justify leaving when the number reaches around 40.

This could stop most tilting as well. You would know that the person that purposely made your game difficult is going to lose way more LP. That's justice.

Yeah they could still AFK, but I want their time to be wasted just like mine is. They shouldn't be able to close the client and come back an hour or two later. These people don't really get in the way of me climbing, they're just so incredibly annoying and such a waste of time. This solution could stop a lot of them from doing that. Nothing is ever going to get rid of people that go AFK in games 100%. That doesn't mean we do nothing.

Also, never call out summoners on the forums like another poster mentioned. Shaming will get you in trouble, and you have a good idea anyways. It isn't necessary.
Guys beware, here comes the "This is a bad idea because it can be abused" posts.

And the "can lead to increased toxicity" posts.
Both of which are perfectly viable.

If people want to punish afk's, hat's fine. But the system should *not* reward the other players.

The core of the problem is premades even existing in ranked.

They're removed next season though. For the most part.

Report the leaver, or rely on leaverbuster, and if they keep up such negative behavior soon they won't be playing _any_ games. So you and some others have some bad games but they lose the ability to play on their account.

That's how it should be...

No doubt but this shit happens more often than you think and couple that with the amount of times we have a horrendous feeder that doesn't afk but stays and feeds continuously. It makes the climb a lot harder than it should be.

I have two solutions. For afks, the game should be changed to allow other players to fill the role through some kind of afk queue. And for feeders, kill gold should be lessened, perhaps halved so smart players have a shot at carrying even though they are teamed with feeders. I think these ideas would drastically reduce the level of toxic behavior as these behaviors are born of frustration with negative elements we cannot control.

Not sure if someone already replied to you or if I am even reading it write addressing the feeding kill gold, but for every death without getting a kill your gold value drops. If you die enough times without getting a kill, you can become worth less gold than a minion. Once you get a kill, then your gold value resets to 300.

> [{quoted}](name=MrAlex20,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4p7WgaVY,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2016-10-26T21:31:53.079+0000)

If you die enough times without getting a kill, you can become worth less gold than a minion. Once you get a kill, then your gold value resets to 300.

It takes quite a while for your value to drop to that of a super minion which is about 50g. I think it's about 7 deaths. Before that point, kill gold is worth multiple minion kills. Even if your CSing is on point, a champion that has been fed 7 kills is still gonna be ahead by a large margin, and when your team mates have exhausted their value, the enemy team is free to take objectives while you're busy trying to farm up some kind of lead so you can stop them and maybe push back. Reducing kill gold would make it easier to catch up fed enemies in gold. As it is now, when you get a 1 kill per 30 second game, the only thing you can do is ff. You are never gonna be able to farm enough to catch up before they take your nexus. The only exception is when you have a tanky team and some wave clear where you can stall the game but that is rare.

Honestly I've had the same philosophy as you about this.

I was in my series for Silver 5 and in the very last game I was playing (2W/2L), both ADC and support (who were in a premade) disconnected at around the 10 minute mark. We lost that game, and although I only lost 10 LP and my series, I was still so fucking salty. It doesn't matter how nice those two people were, they deserved to get banned for at least 2 days each.

Having a DC on your team should not make you lose any LP if you lose the game, and winning with a DC on the enemy team would give you a win and grant you half of the LP you would have gotten. It's just not fair to basically hand over your LP on a silver platter to the enemy team as they gloat how easy the game was because your ADC disconnected.

The report should be filled and if the person did DC or just actively avoid playing the game all other players should be compensated. I.E.

Someone you're not grouped with get's reported and the report actually files meaning that they receive an bonus LP drop while you are given for the sake of this example 5 LP. Unless the match is a victory to keep the flow of LP properly regulated the person in question will still get a kick to the nuts.

You can't tell me that a football team wouldn't get a rematch if a fifth of the team just decided they're going to go into the stands and eat hotdogs or if they all randomly suffered from heart attacks. Honestly I think they'd suspect the opposite team of foul play.

Why should someone whose Internet goes out get punished by losing half a division? Even if they then stop playing ranked for the rest of the day because they know their internet might not work, that's a huge punishment.
